name: Harrison Hot Springs Resort & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Harrison Hot Springs hotel is a top class getaway. I would definatly recomend this hotel to anybody looking for a relaxing break in the lower mainland. the location is excellent.
reviews.title: Great Hotel...Well Worth a Visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: the facilities offered are great, lovely pools, well organised for both adults and children, great dining options again with a good choice for all different groups.
reviews.title: Relax Time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the staff were friendly and service was great, espically in the islands bar, top marks to the barman and lady working there each night. there are a great choice of rooms and each time i stayed we had a lovely relaxing time. breakfast was perfect.great stars to the day.
reviews.title: Pools were amazing!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will definatly return here again.
reviews.title: Birthday to remember!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011
reviews.text: Awesome resort that treat their guests with TLC. Only one bad experience at this resort was the service in the Copper Room resturant. Great sleep and the hot spas, ahhhhhhh!
reviews.title: Swimming pools oooooo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went for one night for our anniversary weekend. We booked online direct with the hotel at a room only rate of $239 for a lake view room. The view was just amazing, the room was in the west wing and really was in need of some updating. On check out we gave the receptionist the details of the faults with the room and she gave us a $40 credit which was at least something.
reviews.title: Not value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We booked specifically at the resort for access to the mineral pools. There are three outdoor 'pools' and two indoor ones. The two indoor ones was a larger pool and a hot tub and stank of chlorine and were packed full of children. Of the outdoor ones the one you could actually swim in was chilly - not sure that it was part of the thermally heated suite of pools. There is an adult pool which is like a large hot tub and lovely and warm. There is also another 'pool' which is just packed full of children and definitely to be avoided. There are no saunas or steam rooms all you have are the pools.
reviews.title: Classy and Friendly, too!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This was a very expensive one night stay for what was actually available at the 'resort'. If we do go to Harrison Hot Springs again we'll camp.
reviews.title: Off Season, best season

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A tip if you are looking for a great place for dinner go to the Old Settler Pub which is just a two minute walk from the hotel. A great place - fabulous service and amazing food with a not too bad house red wine.
reviews.title: Stay away from the older side of the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was recently at Harrison to celebrate a friend's 90th birthday.
reviews.title: We just keep coming Back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Excellent service!
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They allowed us to stay for 2 hours more free of charge after check out to feed our toddler in the room .
reviews.title: A romantic hot springs resort located on a beautiful lake

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Overall very friendly staff and reasonable price.
reviews.title: WHAT A GREAT TIME WE ALL HAD !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: This year we decided to go to this resort in Canada then to our local Sol Duc Hot Springs Resort, WA where is very bad service and unrealistic price.
reviews.title: Good for short family getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We continue to return to Harrison Hot Springs Resort & Spa yearly for our anniversary get away. The rooms in the East Wing are luxurious, comfortable, clean and the service is excellent. These rooms have views and are beautifully appointed with a private balcony. The dining room has excellent food and service, plus a live dance band. The mineral pools and spa are excellent and why we go there. There is golf, children attractions and other attractions nearby. We recommend this hotel highly. Be sure to book the correct hotel, there is another in town with a similar name which isn't the same.
reviews.title: Harrison is always our special place to relax and enjoy each other.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent one night at the Harrison Hot Springs Resort. We actually live quite close to Harrison, and so had not stayed overnight before. The rate for our room was $259 per night and we had a gorgeous view of the lake from the 4th floor! However, the room itself was in need of some attention - without looking very closely I could see stained carpet and a torn bed skirt. And, the tv is very old and outdated - time to upgrade to flatscreens! Also, for the price there should be ipod chargers and much better lighting in the bathroom.
reviews.title: Overrated and overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010
reviews.text: Cleanliness was not very good - the mirror had something sprayed on it, and the patio door track was quite dirty.
reviews.title: Horrible service and policy's

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed was quite comfortable, but I was unable to get the temperature below 70 degrees. I mentioned this at the front desk when checking out and the person checking out beside me said she had the same problem. The girl behind the desk said they likely did not have the "master switch" on yet for the air conditioning, even though it's mid-June. Granted, it was not a hot day, but for $259 per night, I should be able to have the room as hot or as cold as I would like. It was very hot in there all night, and I did not want to leave the patio door open.
reviews.title: The Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pools are very nice and relaxing and we had excellent service in the Copper Room with very good food. The breakfast buffet is overpriced at $16 for a limited selection, and room-temperature food.
reviews.title: Outrageously Overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Basically, you pay to sit in some hot pools, and for a beautiful view of the lake.
reviews.title: If you are under 70, dont go there! Hotel of the Living Dead! Awful..Scary!
